instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00138-A 3 Beeps RAM Issue
threads.message:
Hello

I have this board, no signs of corrosion or any damage. I get voltage in all the big coils, turn on, no video and 3 beeps

Any idea?

threads.title: 820-00138-A 3 Beeps RAM Issue
threads.message:
PCH, CPU, a bad RAM chip or a missing RAM power rail could be possible differentials. 

Post voltages on PP1v35_S3_MEM, PP0v75_S3_MEM_VREFDQ.

threads.title: 820-00138-A 3 Beeps RAM Issue
threads.message:
Be sure the 4 heatsink screws are in place.
If any retainer was bad, check for damage near it.

threads.title: 820-00138-A 3 Beeps RAM Issue
threads.message:
PP1v35_S3_MEM: 1.38V
PP0v75_S3_MEM_VREFDQ_A: 0.698V
PP0v75_S3_MEM_VREFDQ_B: 0.700V  

4 retainers of the heatsink are fine. No damage around retainers either. 

Thanks

threads.title: 820-00138-A 3 Beeps RAM Issue
threads.message:
I doubt will help.
You may change all RAM chips and finally find CPU is the culprit.
Is more economic to replace the board.
